beats.label: HOOK + PROMISE
beats.narration: Should you race Giro Sardegna Gravel? I rated 328 gravel races on 14 dimensions. Giro Sardegna Gravel scored 76 out of 100. Elite tier. Here's what that actually means for your season.
beats.text_on_screen: Should You Race Giro Sardegna Gravel?
beats.editing_note: STATE THE PREMISE IN 8 SECONDS. Clear value prop: 'I rated 328 races. Here's where this one lands.' This is the 8-second decision window. Viewers who stay past 15s are 58% more likely to finish.
beats.psych_mechanism: Curiosity gap (specific) + IKEA effect (viewer predicts the tier before reveal).

beats.label: THE COURSE
beats.narration: Giro Sardegna Gravel. Siniscola, Sardinia, Italy. 81 mi. 130 km, 2.6 thousand m. 75% gravel, 25% paved. Sardinian mountains. rolling terrain, coastal views. Technical rating: 4/5.
beats.text_on_screen: Giro Sardegna Gravel | Siniscola, Sardinia, Italy | 81 mi
beats.editing_note: Let the course breathe. Show the route map, then cut to terrain-specific B-roll. This is the SETUP phase — grounding the viewer before the data analysis. Pacing: 25-40 sec cuts.

beats.label: THE SCORES — Top 8
beats.narration: Time to break down the scorecard. Adventure. 5 out of 5. Type-two fun guaranteed. Type-one fun optional. Beach start, protected coastal dunes, dirt circuits through Mediterranean island terrain—this hits every adventure racing checkbox. Experience. 5 out of 5. This race ruins other races for you. Beach start transitioning to protected coastal dunes, then dirt roads through southeast Sardinia's stunning coastline—this is proper adventure racing. Value. 5 out of 5. Punches way above its price point. You're getting Mediterranean island racing with World Series qualification for whatever the entry fee costs. Length. 4 out of 5. This is a long day. Plan accordingly. The 81-mile/122km elite distance hits the sweet spot for serious gravel racing without becoming a sufferfest. Technicality. 4 out of 5. Bike handling matters here. Practice your descents. Starting on beach sand immediately tests bike handling and power management. Elevation. 4 out of 5. Your power-to-weight ratio matters here. 8,530 feet of climbing over 81 miles delivers consistent challenge without absurd gradients—that's about 105 feet per mile. Prestige. 4 out of 5. Prestigious. People plan seasons around it. UCI Gravel World Series qualifier with 30 years of Giro Sardegna history behind it—that's real pedigree. Race Quality. 4 out of 5. High-quality event. Attention to detail shows. Sophisticated course design starting with 3.
beats.editing_note: PROGRESSIVE RHYTHM: start tight (15-20 sec per dimension), slow down for the most interesting scores (30-40 sec). Each score: number appears, brief pause, explanation. Avatar reacts to extreme scores (5/5 = chef_kiss, 1/5 = facepalm). RE-ENGAGEMENT at 3:00 mark: insert a surprising score reveal or a meme reaction to break the pattern.

beats.label: THE SCORES — Also Scored
beats.narration: And the rest of the scorecard. Community. 4 out of 5. Riders come for the race. Stay for the people. Field Depth. 4 out of 5. Pro-level talent in the mix. Logistics. 3 out of 5. Gets the job done. Nothing fancy. Climate. 3 out of 5. The weather could go either way. Expenses. 3 out of 5. Standard gravel race budget. Altitude. 1 out of 5. Sea level. Your lungs get a day off.

beats.label: VERDICT
beats.narration: Verdict: Sardinian Island Mountain Adventure. If you can hold threshold power on loose surfaces and don't mind mixing beach starts with proper gravel circuits, this delivers. The 50km circuit format means your pacing mistakes get amplified. show up undertrained for those dirt sections and the second lap becomes survival mode. Solid choice if you want UCI World Series points without the full sufferfest of most qualifiers.
beats.editing_note: CLOSE THE MAIN LOOP. 0.5s silence before verdict. Tier badge slams in. Avatar delivers final take. DO NOT signal 'wrapping up' — maintain energy.

beats.label: ALTERNATIVES
beats.narration: If Giro Sardegna Gravel isn't quite right for you. Gravel Worlds qualifiers like Gralloch in Scotland offer similar points with more technical challenge, while SBT GRVL gives you the big-field energy this lacks. If you want Mediterranean vibes with less travel complexity, consider Tuscany Trail or Spanish gravel events that don't require island logistics.
